article_text:
The Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond has again done the public service of toting up all the implied and explicit government guarantees backing the U.S. financial system. Are you sitting down?

Richmond Fed researchers find that as of the end of 2013 taxpayers were standing behind nearly $26 trillion of financial liabilities. The eye-watering sum represents 60% of the financial industry’s $43 trillion in total liabilities. The Richmond Fed calls this measure of the federal safety net its “Bailout Barometer.” Even more...

twitter.description: Uncle Sam still stands behind 60% of all U.S. financial liabilities, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.

image.alt: Uncle Sam still stands behind 60% of all U.S. financial liabilities.

article_summary:
Richmond Fed researchers find that as of the end of 2013 taxpayers were standing behind nearly $26 trillion of financial liabilities.
The Richmond Fed calls this measure of the federal safety net its “Bailout Barometer.” Even more...
The eye-watering sum represents 60% of the financial industry’s $43 trillion in total liabilities.
The Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond has again done the public service of toting up all the implied and explicit government guarantees backing the U.S. financial system.
Are you sitting down?
